page.title: 15LOCAL CONCERNS-N.W.NEWCASTLE
page.content: Often council{housing}built in the area in the 1960's is{in need of {repair.}Residents complain about dampness, mould, smells and flat roofs that leak,all of which make life unpleasant.As a result many houses, especially the flats,are boarded up. {Vandalism}worried many people.Children complained that play areas were often damaged.Buildings were covered with spray paint.Windows are often smashed and premises broken into.Stealing cars for joyrides is another worry.Some people,especially the elderly,are afraid to go out at night incase they get mugged.The{shortage of money}is one of the main problems.Some blame {unemployment}for the rising crime and boredom for the amount of vandalism. The police try their best to prevent crime and have a policy of{community {policing}in the area.
